titlePart.text: TEXTILES AND FLEXIBLE MATERIALS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
NATURAL OR ARTIFICIAL THREADS OR FIBRES

titlePart.entryReference: fibres or filaments of softened glass, minerals, or slag

noteParagraph.text: In this class, the following words are used with the meanings indicated:
"fibre" means a relatively-short, elongated member of natural or artifical material.
"filament" means an endless or quasi-endless, elongated member of natural or artificial material.
"yarn" means a unitary assembly of fibres, usually produced by spinning.
"thread" means an assembly of yarns or filaments, usually produced by twisting.

titlePart.entryReference: unwinding, paying-out, forwarding, winding, or coiling filamentary material, not intimately associated with spinning or twisting,
cores, formers, supports, or holders for coiled or wound material, e.g. bobbins,
crimping or curling of fibres, filaments, or yarns
testing yarns, rovings, slivers, fibres, or fibre webs

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the note following the class title of class .

titlePart.text: Kinds or types of spinning or twisting machines
Spinning or twisting machines in which the product is wound-up continuously
Cup, pot, or disc type, in which annular masses of yarn are formed by centrifugal action
for imparting multiple twist, e.g. two-for-one twisting
and twist is inserted into groups of independently-moving fibres separated or broken from a strand, e.g. open-end spinning, ringless spinning, break spinning
in which twisting is due to a fluid, e.g. air vortex, GÃ¶tzfried type apparatus
in which the twisting and collecting operation is due to a rotative surface

titlePart.entryReference: package supports of general application for supplying filamentary material
interrelated flyer and bobbin drive mechanisms

titlePart.text: each spindle driven by an electric motor
for two or more machine elements possessing different characteristics but in operative association
Arrangements for winding reserve lengths of yarn on take-up packages, e.g. transfer tails
Arrangements for connecting continuously-delivered material to bobbins or the like
titlePart.entryReference: arrangements for securing yarn to bobbins, cores, or the like of general application in the winding of filamentary material

titlePart.text: Guards or protectors for yarns or threads, e.g. separator plates, anti-ballooning devices
Spinning or twisting machines in which the product is wound-up intermittently, e.g. mules

titlePart.entryReference: creels of general interest in providing a supply of filamentary material
drafting arrangements of general application in spinning machines

titlePart.text: Driving arrangements intimately associated with tin rollers
Spindle-driving arrangements during drawing-out or backing-off
Driving or stopping arrangements not otherwise provided for

titlePart.entryReference: arrangements in which draft is dependent on linear movement of take-up spindles, e.g. in mules,
devices for combing or orienting fibres for open-end spinning machines

titlePart.text: Gill boxes or other drafting machines employing fallers or like pinned bars
with pinned bars actuated by screw members
with bars connected by links, chains, or the like
with pinned bars unconnected with each other but actuated through pressure of one against another
Drafting machines or arrangements without fallers or like pinned bars
in which fibres are controlled by contact with stationary or reciprocating surfaces
in which fibres are controlled by rollers only
with porcupines or like pinned rotary members
in which fibres are controlled by one or more endless aprons
in which fibres are controlled by inserting twist during drafting
incorporating arrangements for severing continuous filaments, e.g. in direct spinning
titlePart.entryReference: converting tows to slivers or yarns

titlePart.text: according to a pre-arranged pattern, e.g. to produce slubs
in response to irregularities in material
Adjusting drafting elements, e.g. altering ratch

titlePart.entryReference: saddles or top roller arms forming essential components of weighting arrangements

titlePart.text: Arrangements maintaining drafting elements free of fibre accumulations
Rollers or aprons with cleaning surfaces

titlePart.entryReference: guides for slivers, rovings, or yarns applicable solely for spinning, twisting, curling, or crimping purposes
guides of general application for handling filamentary material

titlePart.text: with flutes or other integral surface characteristics

titlePart.entryReference: spindle bearings, supports therefor, in general

titlePart.text: Arrangements for coupling bobbins or like to spindles
Arrangements on spindles for suppressing yarn balloons

titlePart.entryReference: flyers solely for guiding filamentary material during unwinding

titlePart.text: arranged to guide material over exterior of legs
with guide channels formed in legs, e.g. slubbing flyers
with haul pulleys or like arrangements
Drag arrangements for bobbins or flyers
Devices attached to, or integral with, flyers for temporarily increasing twist in material passing to them
Interrelated flyer and bobbin drive mechanisms, e.g. winding-on motions for cotton-roving frames
Manufacture thereof not otherwise provided for

titlePart.entryReference: poker guides and other rail supports

titlePart.entryReference: removing yarn from centrifugal cups on to yarn carriers

titlePart.text: for supplying bobbins, cores, receptacles, or completed packages to, or transporting from, paying-out or take-up stations

titlePart.text: Arrangements preventing snarls or inadvertent doubling of yarns
Warning or safety devices, e.g. automatic fault detectors, stop motions
titlePart.entryReference: warning or safety devices for filamentary material, not intimately associated with spinning or like machines

titlePart.text: responsive to reduction in material tension, failure of supply, or breakage, of material
responsive to excessive tension or irregular operation of apparatus
responsive to presence of irregularities in running material
responsive to delivery of a measured length of material, completion of winding of a package or filling of a receptacle
Arrangements facilitating the inspection or testing of yarns or the like in connection with spinning or twisting
Moistening, sizing, oiling, waxing, colouring, or drying yarns or the like as incidental measures during spinning or twisting
Counting, measuring, recording, or registering devices
titlePart.entryReference: in general in the appropriate sub-class of Section G, e.g.
in machines for producing textile fabrics, see appropriate sub-classes
of general interest in connection with the forwarding or winding of filamentary material
